[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I just finished my computer course, and I learned so much about using computers effectively.
That's great! What did you learn specifically?
Oh, a lot of things. I learned how to use different programs and software for different tasks, and how to choose the right one depending on what I need to do.
Do you have any software recommendations for me? I always struggle with choosing the right program.
It really depends on what you need the software for. But for basic tasks like word processing or spreadsheet management, I would recommend Microsoft Office. It's user-friendly and versatile.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Offering help with homework', 'Related Summaries': 'Classmates A offers to help Classmates B with their homework.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Classmates A: Hey, I noticed you're struggling with your homework. Is there anything I can do to help? ### Classmates B: Really? That would be amazing! I've been behind on some of my assignments. ### Classmates A: Don't worry, I'll help you out. I know how it can be difficult to keep up with schoolwork sometimes. ### Classmates B: Thanks, you're such a great friend. You know, speaking of being helpful, remember when you kicked that door in and got grounded for a week? ### Classmates A: Yeah, I remember. That was such a dumb mistake. ### Classmates B: Well, you've definitely matured since then. Like when you went to the club to see Sasha dance and didn't get in trouble. ### Classmates A: Haha, yeah. I've learned from my past mistakes. And speaking of being there for each other, remember when you listened to me when I was going through a tough time? ### Classmates B: Of course I remember. That's what friends are for. Thanks again for helping me with my homework.' }
```
